en: Superintendent, I hope you're prepared for some mouthwatering hamburgers!
I thought we were having steamed clams?
Oh, not in Utica, no. It's an Albany expression.
And you call them "Steamed Hams" despite the fact that they are obviously grilled.
*yawns* That was wonderful. A good time was had by all, I'm pooped.
Good lord, what is happening in there?
Really. Well I'm from Utica and I've never heard anyone use the phrase "Steamed Hams".
These hamburgers are quite similar to the ones they have at Krustyburger
Oh ho ho, no. Patented Skinnerburgers! Old family recipe.
In this part of the country
Well Seymore you are an odd fellow but I must say you steam a good ham.
Seymore! The house is on fire!
No, mother, that's just the Northern Lights.
Doh, no, I said steamed hams. That's what I call hamburgers! It's a regional dialect.
